Class WekaClassifier

extends java.lang.Object

Method Detail

Build

public void Build(WekaData inData)
Trains the classifier on the given data, this is the heart function of every classifier, and should be called after data is input, or new data is in

Parameters:
inData - WekaData to train on
See Also:
WekaData

Classify

public int[] Classify(WekaData testData)
Given the test data, runs the trained classifier on it, assigns the result of classification to an integer array and returns it

Parameters:
testData - WekaData that contains the test dataset
Returns:
Integer array of results 1-to-1 on the test dataset

Classify

public int Classify(java.lang.Object[] data)
Takes the given object array of an instance and classifies it, this function should be used for classifiers that return class number

If the function is used on a multi class classifier that implements distributionForInstance method instead of classifyInstance, it will be invalid.

To make sure there are no mistakes, best thing to do is check the classifier doc's. Later on a smarter way of handling classify might be implemented.

Parameters:
data - Object Array of the instance
Returns:
index of the class the instance is classified into
See Also:
ClassifyProbs

ClassifyProbs

public double[] ClassifyProbs(java.lang.Object[] data)
Given the object array of an instance values, will return the probability of every class. If the classifier does not support this method will return an array of doubles with only the classified class' value 1.0 and rest 0.0

Parameters:
data - Object Array of the instance
Returns:
index of the class the instance is classified into
See Also:
Classify
